title: Panasonic 4K 2018 TVs now support Amazon Alexa and Google Assistant | Trusted Reviews
description:
![](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg) Panasonic FZ950

**Panasonic releases voice control firmware update for its European 4K TVs.**

Owners of Panasonic 4K TVs will now have access to a firmware update
(available since October 30th), that implements [Amazon
Alexa](https://www.trustedreviews.com/opinion/amazon-alexa-guide-3462356) and
[Google Assistant](https://www.trustedreviews.com/opinion/google-asssistant-
guide-features-entertainment-smart-home-and-more-3462823) compatibility on the
Japanese company’s 2018 range of smart 4K TVs.

The update enables owners to use voice control functionality to turn the TV on
and off, change the channel as well as adjust the volume through a compatible
smart speaker.

**Related:[Best 4K TVs 2018 – 6 top UHD TVs on the
market](https://www.trustedreviews.com/best/best-4k-tv-3500597)**

To facilitate the update, owners must ensure that the TV is connected to the
internet. When opening any internet connected application, a pop-up window
will appear with an invitation to update the set. Once done, the TV can then
be set-up with a compatible speaker through the Google Home or Alexa app.

Two TVs that have received the update were the
[F952](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/panasonic-fz950-fz952-oled) and
[F802](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/panasonic-fz802-fz800-oled) OLED
TVs and we gave both of them high praise. It’s been a year where Panasonic has
arguably stepped up its performance in the realm of 4K TVs.

**Is voice control a feature you use when watching TV? Drop us a line on
Facebook or tweet at as @TrustedReviews**
